newsitem.title: POLAND: Treasury's BPH shares not on sale in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Treasury's BPH shares not on sale in 1997.

text.p: The Polish treasury ministry is unlikely to sell its 46.6 percent stake in Bank Przemyslowo-Handlowy (BPH) this year, a treasury official said on Tuesday.

"As far as I know, the sale of the treasury-held stake of BPH is not expected in 1997," Ryszard Worobiej, a deputy director of the ministry's joint-stock companies department, told Reuters during the bank's general shareholders meeting.
BPH president Henryka Pieronkiewicz, also present, said the treasury's plan to retain its stake this year had no impact on the bank's development strategy. She did not elaborate.
Gazeta Wyborcza daily earlier quoted Pieronkiewicz as saying that the bank hoped to find a buyer for the treasury's stake in the first quarter of 1997.
